verses.roman:
ei-mata tāṅra ghare garva cūrṇa kari'
phalgu-tīrthe tabe cali āilā gaurahari

synonyms: ei-mata—in this way; tāṅra ghare—at his place; garva—pride; cūrṇa—broken; kari'-making; phalgu-tīrthe—to the holy place named Phalgu-tīrtha; tabe—then; cali—walking; āilā—came; gaurahari—Lord Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu.
translation: Thus Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu broke the pride of the Tattvavādīs to pieces. He then went to the holy place known as Phalgu-tīrtha.
